channel.title: Php
channel.description: Hey I just decided to start with web development cuz i needed somethig to do in my free time. i have the PHP Designer 2007 - Professional 5.3.2 and i would like to get started so i was wondering if any one could recomend a site that i could go to to look for some tutorials? thanks for any one who helps

item.title: Php
item.dc:creator: @javis javis
item.description:
@javis wrote:

click im fealling lucky? never used that. also i have searched php tutorials and alot of the sites i find arnt very good im just looking for peoples oppinion on sites so i get a good site not just some site that i find

Read full topic

item.title: Php
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“javis, post:7, topic:175931”][quote author=S!ms link=topic=236602.msg2014016#msg2014016 date=1201307678]
Teach me how you can have troubles finding a php lesson
[/quote] on alot of the ones that i went to it was stuff you eather had to register for or the guides that a tryed to use but they where extremely hard to follow and alot of them you needed to dl tons of extra files. Also please dont post if your post isnt about what im looking for thanks[/quote]

I can do it in 3 steps, observe:

Step 1) Open google.com(not google.co.uk, google.co.jp or any other local google sites, but google.com)
Step 2) Type “php tutorial”, with or without the quotes(no, not here, in the google search box)
Step 3) Click I’m feeling lucky.

Read full topic
